marketNews.title: US Delays Tariffs for Canada & Mexico; China Responds with Tariffs for the US
marketNews.content: President of the United States, Donald Trump, announced a postponement of the implementation of an import tariff of 25 percent for Canada and Mexico for 30 days while negotiations are ongoing to increase law‑enforcement efforts at the borders of those countries with the United States. At the same time, an additional import tariff of 10 percent for China will take effect as scheduled on Tuesday (4/2) local time. This agreement comes only a few days after Trump announced last weekend that he would impose a 25 percent import tariff on Canada and Mexico and an additional tariff of 10 percent on top of the existing tariff for China on Tuesday (4/2). Trump previously said that the tariffs were a response to the flow of narcotics and immigrants coming to the United States from those countries. As the US tariffs become effective, China announced on Tuesday (4/2) afternoon that it will impose additional import tariffs on several US commodities starting 10 February 2025, consisting of: an additional 15 percent tariff on coal and liquefied natural gas (LNG); an additional 10 percent tariff on crude oil, agricultural machinery, large‑engine cars, and pickup trucks. In addition to the extra tariffs, China also took several other actions, such as an investigation into alleged anti‑monopoly violations by Google, imposing export restrictions on tungsten and other rare earth elements in technology products, and limiting the operations of several US companies such as Illumina and PVH Corp. Following these developments, the US dollar index (DXY) and US equity futures moved volatile on Tuesday (4/2). DXY rose to above 109 before settling at 108.5. Meanwhile, S&P 500 futures fell 0.16 percent after having risen 0.78 percent early in the session. Commodity prices subject to the additional Chinese tariffs also fell, with WTI crude oil futures down 2.06 percent to $71.7 per barrel and natural gas futures down 3.98 percent to $3.22 per MMBtu.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Developments in the trade war continue to be a major issue for investors. Before China announced its retaliatory tariffs, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said that Trump will meet Chinese President Xi Jinping in the coming days. In addition, how the Chinese government will set the exchange rate range against the US dollar after the long weekend on Wednesday (5/2) will also be a focus for investors because it may give clues about China's stance toward US tariffs. This article was previously released on Tuesday (4/2) morning in Stockbit Commentary.

marketNews.title: DPR Passes Amendment to State-Owned Enterprises Law Establishing BPI Danantara
marketNews.content: The House of Representatives approved an amendment to the State-Owned Enterprises Law on Tuesday (4/2), which will become the legal basis for the establishment of the Danantara National Investment Management Agency (BPI Danantara) to manage state assets. The agency, which will be supervised by ministers and report directly to the president, will be founded with a capital of around 1,000 trillion rupiah in cash, state‑owned assets, or government shares. This capital amount is based on the combined capital of state‑owned enterprises in 2023, which reached 1,135 trillion rupiah. Bloomberg reported that BPI Danantara is an initiative of President Prabowo to mobilize more funding for strategic projects without inflating the state budget. The Minister of State‑Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, did not specify which SOEs would be transferred to BPI Danantara, but national media mentioned that seven SOEs will be managed by the agency in its initial phase: Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), PT PLN, PT Pertamina, Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Telkom Indonesia (TLKM), and Mining Industry Indonesia (MIND ID).

marketNews.title: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Bahlil Lahadalia Announces Mandatory Use of Coal Price Benchmark for Exporters
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Bahlil Lahadalia said on Monday (3/2) that the government plans to require coal exporters to use the Coal Price Benchmark (HBA) in export transactions. The proposal aims to maintain stability of Indonesian coal prices in the global market and prevent prices from falling too low. The regulation is still being drafted and will later be issued as a Ministerial Decree. Bahlil warned that the ministry will be strict with companies that do not comply, including the possibility of revoking export licenses.

marketNews.title: Minister of Manpower Yassierli Discusses Upcoming Regulation on Holiday Allowance for Gig Workers
marketNews.content: Minister of Manpower Yassierli said that the government is reviewing regulations on the provision of holiday allowance (THR) for workers with partner status, such as online motorbike riders, online taxi drivers, and couriers. The regulation is expected to be finalized within the next two weeks.

marketNews.title: India's Palm Oil Imports Hit 14-Year Low as CPO Imports Drop 46% MoM
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that India's crude palm oil (CPO) imports in January 2025 fell 46 percent month‑on‑month to 272,000 tons, the lowest level since March 2011. The decline was driven by Indian refiners switching from CPO to cheaper soybean oil. The drop in Indian CPO imports, which is the world's largest vegetable oil importer, could put pressure on the benchmark CPO price in Malaysia.

marketNews.title: Minister Bahlil Lahadalia Announces New Natural Gas Price Incentive (HGBT) Rates for Export‑Oriented Industries
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Bahlil Lahadalia said on Monday (3/2) that a specific natural gas price incentive (HGBT) will not be granted to export‑oriented industries. However, he clarified that not all export‑oriented industries will be excluded from HGBT. Bahlil also stated that HGBT will be set at US$7 per MMBtu for PLN and US$6.5 per MMBtu for industrial raw material inputs. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto added that the new HGBT rates will start to be applied no later than the end of the first quarter of 2025.

marketNews.title: Deputy Speaker of DPR Sufmi Dasco Ahmad Reports President Prabowo Orders Reopening of LPG 3 kg Retail Sales
marketNews.content: Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives, Sufmi Dasco Ahmad, said on Tuesday (4/2) that President Prabowo Subianto has instructed Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Bahlil Lahadalia to allow retailers to sell 3‑kilogram liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) again. This follows a ministry regulation that banned the sale of subsidized LPG by retailers starting 1 February 2025, which caused public protests because consumers had to queue at Pertamina stations. The statement came a day after Bahlil said the ministry is studying the option of designating 3‑kg LPG as an official sub‑base for Pertamina. According to Deputy Minister of Energy Yuliot Tanjung, the ban aims to ensure that subsidized LPG reaches the rightful and needy consumers.

marketNews.title: Minister of Investment and Downstream Rosan Roeslani Comments on French Miner Eramet Exploring New Mining Areas in South Sulawesi and Papua
marketNews.content: Minister of Investment and Downstream Rosan Roeslani said on Tuesday (4/2) that French mining company Eramet (EPA: ERMT) is exploring new mining areas in South Sulawesi and Papua. He also mentioned that Eramet plans to develop an electric vehicle project involving various strategic partners. Eramet has not commented on the matter. Its main operation in Indonesia is the Weda Bay nickel mine in Halmahera, North Maluku.

marketNews.title: Chairman of Indonesian Cement Association Lilik Unggul Raharjo Projects Domestic Cement Sales Growth of 1-2% YoY in 2025
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Cement Association, Lilik Unggul Raharjo, said that domestic cement sales are expected to grow around 1‑2 percent year‑on‑year in 2025, while export sales are expected to remain at the same level as previous years. He noted that the industry will still face challenges from low utilization rates, but sees growth potential due to the government's program to build three million houses per year. The association projects total cement sales of 77 million tons in 2025 with a utilization rate of 65 percent.

tickerNews.title: Grab Considers Acquiring GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Valued Over US$7 Billion
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB) is considering acquiring GoTo Gojek Tokopedia with a valuation of more than US$7 billion. Bloomberg sources said one scenario under discussion is the purchase of all GoTo shares at a price above 100 rupiah per share, roughly 15 percent higher than the share price on Tuesday (4/2) at 87 rupiah per share. A GoTo spokesperson declined to comment, while Grab's representative has not provided a statement. The Bloomberg report followed a DealStreetAsia article stating that GoTo and Grab have accelerated merger talks and aim to reach a deal in 2025. The two ride‑hailing companies have been discussing a merger for several years to reduce costs and competitive pressure, but the plan has faced challenges such as disagreements between parties and potential antitrust hurdles. Bloomberg also noted that the current merger talks may not result in any transaction.

tickerNews.title: DEWA Plans to Acquire 92.5% of J Resources Asia Pacific, Offering 400 Rupiah per Share
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg Technoz reported that Darma Henwa (DEWA) intends to acquire 92.5 percent of J Resources Asia Pacific from its owner Jimmy Budiarto at an offer price of 400 rupiah per share, which is 41 percent higher than the PSAB closing price on Tuesday (4/2) at 284 rupiah per share. DEWA's management told Bloomberg Technoz that the company is unaware of the issue. Earlier, Bloomberg Technoz reported in early August 2024 that Delta Dunia Makmur (DOID) and the Salim group – through Amman Mineral Internasional (AMMN) – each planned to buy 92.5 percent of PSAB from Jimmy Budiarto in 1Q25. Bloomberg Technoz said DOID offered 300 rupiah per share, while the Salim group reportedly offered 350 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: Bukit Asam Reports Coal Sales Volume of 42.9 Million Tons in 2024, Targets 50 Million Tons in 2025
tickerNews.content: Bukit Asam recorded a coal sales volume of 42.9 million tons in 2024, a 16 percent year‑on‑year increase, slightly below the 2024 guidance of 43.1 million tons but marking the highest sales volume in PTBA's history. Sales consisted of 20.3 million tons exported (30.5 percent YoY increase) and 22.6 million tons sold domestically (5.6 percent YoY increase). Quarterly, PTBA reported 11.6 million tons sold in 4Q24, a 3.4 percent quarter‑on‑quarter rise and a 16.3 percent YoY increase. PTBA targets coal production of 50 million tons in 2025 (15.5 percent YoY) and a sales volume of 50.1 million tons (16.8 percent YoY).

tickerNews.title: Central Omega Resources Reports Nickel Ore Production of 1.2 Million WMT in 4Q24 and Secures RKAB Permit
tickerNews.content: Central Omega Resources reported a nickel ore production volume of 1.2 million wet metric tons (WMT) in 4Q24, a 112 percent year‑on‑year increase and a 17 percent quarter‑on‑quarter rise. This result brought total nickel ore production for 2024 to 3 million WMT, a 130 percent YoY increase, equal to 134 percent of the 2024 target of 2.2 million WMT. The company also recorded nickel ore sales of 852,903 WMT in 4Q24, a 55 percent YoY increase but an 18 percent QoQ decline, resulting in total 2024 nickel ore sales of 2.6 million WMT, a 105 percent YoY increase and 118 percent of the 2024 target of 2.2 million WMT. In July 2024, DKFT obtained a RKAB production permit for 2.95 million WMT per year for 2025 and 2026.

tickerNews.title: Puradelta Lestari Records Marketing Sales of 1.87 Trillion Rupiah in 2024, Exceeding Target
tickerNews.content: Puradelta Lestari reported marketing sales of 1.87 trillion rupiah in 2024, stable compared with the 2023 realization and surpassing the 2024 target of 1.81 trillion rupiah at 104 percent. The industrial segment contributed about 96.1 percent of total marketing sales in 2024 through the sale of industrial land covering 59 hectares, with more than 60 percent of industrial marketing sales coming from data center projects. The residential segment contributed 2.3 percent and the commercial segment 1.6 percent.

tickerNews.title: Hasmoro Purchases 787,000 HEAL Shares at Average Price 1,434 Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Hasmoro, who is both a shareholder and the President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, bought 787,000 HEAL shares at an average price of 1,434 rupiah per share on 30 January 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 1.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Hasmoro's ownership in HEAL increased from about 4.720 percent to 4.725 percent.

tickerNews.title: Tugu Pratama Indonesia Plans to Divest Overseas Property Assets Worth 1 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Tugu Pratama Indonesia will sell overseas property assets with a divestment value of up to 1 trillion rupiah. The company's President Director, Tatang Nurhidayat, confirmed that offers have been received for the overseas property assets, although he did not disclose the exact amount. The proceeds from the divestment will be used for other more liquid investments, and possibly to strengthen the capital of Tugu's overseas subsidiaries.

tickerNews.title: PT PP Reports New Contract Value of 27.09 Trillion Rupiah in 2024, 14.5% Decrease YoY
tickerNews.content: The Company Secretary of PT PP, Joko Raharjo, said that the company recorded a new contract value of 27.09 trillion rupiah in 2024, a 14.5 percent year‑on‑year decline, achieving only 84.7 percent of the 2024 target of 32 trillion rupiah. According to the source, 44 percent of the new contract value came from government projects, 29 percent from state‑owned enterprises, and 27 percent from private sector projects. Previously, Joko mentioned that the company aims for a 5 percent year‑on‑year growth in new contract value in 2025.

tickerNews.title: VKTR Director Dino Ahmad Ryandi Acquires 15 Million Shares at Average Price 100 Rupiah
tickerNews.content: The Director of VKTR Mobility Technology, Dino Ahmad Ryandi, bought 15 million VKTR shares at an average price of 100 rupiah per share on 30 January 2025. The total transaction value amounted to 1.5 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Dino Ahmad Ryandi's ownership in VKTR increased from zero to 0.03 percent.

tickerNews.title: Logisticplus International Director Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko Purchases 304 Million Shares at Average Price 39 Rupiah
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder and President Director of Logisticplus International, Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko, bought 304 million LOPI shares at an average price of 39 rupiah per share on 13 January 2025. The total transaction value was 11.9 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko's ownership in LOPI increased from 39.3 percent to 67 percent.
